message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a general approach for training Energy-Based Models (EBMs) over sequences, which can be applied to any sequential EBM. The approach is related to Policy Gradient techniques in Reinforcement Learning (RL), but in a distributional perspective. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CL (Computation and Language), as the paper deals with learning and modeling sequential data. Additionally, cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are also possible sub-categories, as the proposed approach can be applied to image and audio data, and involves neural networks.
